District Four

Darius Ewing

Term expires May 2025

  • Email ccouncil4@wacotx.gov

  • Darius Ewing moved to Waco in 2012 to attend Baylor University and has called Waco home ever since. After Baylor, Ewing worked as the portfolio manager for Rydell Real Estate, a local real estate holdings firm. While overseeing developments, Darius began interacting with various city departments deepening his understanding of the inner workings of our city.

He went on to serve on Wacoâ€™s Building Standards Commission until his appointment to Waco City Council in June 2020. Being the youngest councilmember in our cityâ€™s history didnâ€™t prevent Darius from jumping in and making an impact right away. Just after his appointment he began working closely with Prosper Waco to launch UpSkill Waco, a job training program that equips Wacoans with the skills necessary to obtain high-paying, permanent employment.

Since last serving on council, Darius has joined the United Way of Waco-McLennan Countyâ€™s Community Impact Committee and serves as a board member for Keep Waco Beautiful and Waco Downtown Farmerâ€™s Market.

Darius and his wife Hannah are active members of Highland Baptist Church, and the Dean Highland Neighborhood Association. On most days, you can find Darius walking their two dogs, Griffin and Otis, around the Dean Highland neighborhood.
